what: Deriving the PDE for gonadic mass
title: Gonadic mass dynamics
text: Standard mizer describes number density N(w,t)N(w,t) PDE ∂N∂t=−∂∂w(gN)−μN,\begin{equation} \frac{\partial N}{\partial t} = -\frac{\partial}{\partial w}(g\,N)-\mu\,N, \label{PDEN} \end{equation} g(w,t)g(w,t) growth rate individual size ww μ(w,t)\mu(w,t) death rate. equation simply states rate change number individuals infinitesimal size range around ww given difference rate individuals grow size range rate grow (transport term), minus rate die (loss term). Instead number density NN used biomass density B=wNB = w\,N describe population. evolution equation can easily derived : ∂B∂t=w∂N∂t=−w∂∂w(gBw)−μB,=−∂∂w(gB)+gBw−μB.\begin{equation}\begin{split} \frac{\partial B}{\partial t} &= w\frac{\partial N}{\partial t} = -w\frac{\partial}{\partial w}\left(g\,\frac{B}{w}\right)-\mu\,B,\\ &=-\frac{\partial}{\partial w}\left(g\,B\right)+g\,\frac{B}{w}-\mu\,B. \end{split}\end{equation} intuitive: addition transport term loss term now also source term gB/w=gNg B/w = gN representing coming growth taking place within infinitesimal size class. now denote Q(w,t)Q(w,t) total gonadic biomass density G(w,t)G(w,t) gonadic growth rate individual size ww (reproducing), satisfy analogous equation ∂Q∂t=−∂∂w(gQ)+GN−μQ−rQ,\begin{equation} \frac{\partial Q}{\partial t}  =-\frac{\partial}{\partial w}\left(g\,Q\right)+G\,N-\mu\,Q-r\,Q, \end{equation} additional loss term representing release gonadic mass reproduction. release rate r(w,t)r(w,t) encode seasonality reproduction. mizer, total energy ErE_r available growth reproduction split g=Er(1−ψ)g=E_r(1-\psi) G=ErψG=E_r\psi. Thus G=gψ/(1−ψ)G=g\,\psi/(1-\psi). Instead considering total gonadic biomass density Q(w,t)Q(w,t), consider gonadic mass q(w,t)q(w,t) individual fish size ww, given q=QN.\begin{equation} q= \frac{Q}{N}. \end{equation} Let’s derive evolution PDE: ∂q∂t=1N∂Q∂t−QN2∂N∂t=1N(−∂∂w(gQ)+GN−μQ−rQ)−QN2(−∂∂w(gN)−μN).\begin{equation}\label{PDEwG}\begin{split} \frac{\partial q}{\partial t} &= \frac{1}{N}\frac{\partial Q}{\partial t}- \frac{Q}{N^2}\frac{\partial N}{\partial t}\\ &=\frac{1}{N}\left(-\frac{\partial}{\partial w}\left(g\,Q\right)+G\,N-\mu\,Q-r\,Q\right) -\frac{Q}{N^2}\left(-\frac{\partial}{\partial w}(g\,N)-\mu\,N\right). \end{split}\end{equation} simplify observe two mortality terms cancel QN2∂∂w(gN)=qN∂∂w(gQq)=1N∂∂w(gQ)−g∂q∂w.\begin{equation}\begin{split} \frac{Q}{N^2}\frac{\partial}{\partial w}(g\,N) &=\frac{q}{N}\frac{\partial}{\partial w}\left(g\,\frac{Q}{q}\right)\\ &=\frac{1}{N}\frac{\partial}{\partial w}\left(g\,Q\right) -g\,\frac{\partial q}{\partial w}. \end{split}\end{equation} Substituting cancelling terms gives ∂q∂t=G−g∂q∂w−rq.\begin{equation} \frac{\partial q}{\partial t}=G-g\,\frac{\partial q}{\partial w}-r\, q. \label{wg} \end{equation} point feel bit stupid realise dq(w,t)dt=∂q(w,t)∂t+∂q(w,t)∂wdwdt\begin{equation} \frac{dq(w,t)}{dt}=\frac{\partial q(w,t)}{\partial t}+ \frac{\partial q(w,t)}{\partial w}\frac{dw}{dt} \end{equation} dw/dt=gdw/dt = g, reduces dqdt=G−rq,\begin{equation}\label{dqdt} \frac{dq}{dt}=G-r\,q, \end{equation} written immediately, given definition GG. equation good starting point deriving PDE . equations species specific. particular one gonadic mass function qi(w,t)q_i(w,t) species ii need specify one rate function ri(w,t)r_i(w,t) species ii. need specify mass-specific release rate r(w,t)r(w,t). determines total reproduction rate Rp(t)=ϵ2w0∫N(w,t)q(w,t)r(w,t)dw.\begin{equation} R_p(t)=\frac{\epsilon}{2w_0}\int N(w,t)q(w,t)r(w,t)dw. \end{equation} difficult know choose mass-specific rate r(w,t)r(w,t) produce observed egg production rate Rp(t)R_p(t). ’ll probably trial error initially. rate r(w,t)r(w,t) become large least year gonadic mass goes back close zero. One possibility make r(w,t)r(w,t) independent ww.

title: Gonadic mass dynamics
text: solve PDE use upwind-difference scheme used mizer solve PDE . Let us therefore recall details scheme. discretise follows: Nwt+1−NwtΔt=−gwtNwt+1−gw−1tNw−1t+1Δw−μwtNwt+1.\begin{equation}\label{nd}     \frac{N_w^{t+1}-N_w^t}{\Delta t}=-\frac{g_w^tN_w^{t+1}-g_{w-1}^tN_{w-1}^{t+1}}{\Delta w}-\mu_w^t\,N_w^{t+1}. \end{equation} use ww tt denote integer indices discretised weight discretised time respectively. Multiplying Δt\Delta t collecting terms gives Nwt+1(1+gwtΔtΔw+μwtΔt)=Nw−1t+1(gw−1tΔtΔw)+Nwt.\begin{equation}\label{ndc}     N_w^{t+1}\left(1+g_w^t\frac{\Delta t}{\Delta w}+\mu_w^t\,\Delta t\right)=     N_{w-1}^{t+1}\left(g_{w-1}^t\frac{\Delta t}{\Delta w}\right)     +N_w^t. \end{equation} Solving Nwt+1N_w^{t+1} gives Nwt+1=Swt−AwtNw−1t+1Bwt,\begin{equation}\label{nds}     N_w^{t+1}=\frac{S_w^t-A_w^tN_{w-1}^{t+1}}{B_w^t}, \end{equation} Awt=−gw−1tΔtΔw,Bwt=1+gwtΔtΔw+μwtΔt,Swt=Nwt.\begin{equation}\label{ABS} \begin{split}    A_w^t&=-g_{w-1}^t\frac{\Delta t}{\Delta w},\\    B_w^t&=1+g_w^t\frac{\Delta t}{\Delta w}+\mu^t_w\,\Delta t,\\    S_w^t&=N_w^t. \end{split} \end{equation} Given initial value boundary condition encoding influx new-born individuals smallest size class, recurrence relation allows mizer calculate Nwt+1N_w^{t+1} size classes later times. Now use scheme gonadic dynamics. discretise follows: qwt+1−qwtΔt=−gwtqwt+1−qw−1t+1Δw−rwtqwt+1+Gwt.\begin{equation}     \frac{q_w^{t+1}-q_w^t}{\Delta t}=-g_w^t\frac{q_w^{t+1}-q_{w-1}^{t+1}}{\Delta w}-r_w^t\,q_w^{t+1}+G_w^t. \end{equation} Note close equation qq equation NN. Multiplying Δt\Delta t collecting terms gives qwt+1(1+gwtΔtΔw+rwtΔt)=qw−1t+1(gwtΔtΔw)+qwt+GwtΔt.\begin{equation}     q_w^{t+1}\left(1+g_w^t\frac{\Delta t}{\Delta w}+r_w^t\,\Delta t\right)=     q_{w-1}^{t+1}\left(g_w^t\frac{\Delta t}{\Delta w}\right)     +q_w^t+G_w^t\,\Delta t. \end{equation} Solving qwt+1q_w^{t+1} gives qwt+1=swt−awtqw−1t+1bwt,\begin{equation}\label{qds}     q_w^{t+1}=\frac{s_w^t-a_w^tq_{w-1}^{t+1}}{b_w^t}, \end{equation} awt=−gwtΔtΔw,bwt=1+gwtΔtΔw+rwtΔt,swt=qwt+GwtΔt.\begin{equation}\label{abs} \begin{split}    a_w^t&=-g_w^t\frac{\Delta t}{\Delta w},\\    b_w^t&=1+g_w^t\frac{\Delta t}{\Delta w}+r_w^t\,\Delta t,\\    s_w^t&=q_w^t+G_w^t\,\Delta t. \end{split} \end{equation} Together initial value boundary condition q1t=0q_1^t=0 times smallest individuals yet gonadic mass, recurrence relation allows us calculate qwt+1q_w^{t+1} size classes later times. Note small difference discretised equation qq equation NN. difference lies replacing Awt,BwtA_w^t, B_w^t SwtS_w^t given awt,bwta_w^t, b_w^t swts_w^t given .

title: Gonadic mass dynamics
text: modelling cohorts mizer, diffusion terms size-spectrum dynamics become important, lead broadening cohorts. yet know required step sizes size time faithfully reproduce dynamics. large size steps lead much numerical diffusion. large time steps may lead numerical instability.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Delius G, Spence M (2024). mizerSeasonal: Implementing Seasonality Mizer. R package version 0.0.0.9002, https://github.com/gustavdelius/mizerSeasonal.

title: Implementing Seasonality in Mizer
text: Implementing seasonality mizer first step implement accumulation gonadic mass throughout year release spawning periods. See “Get started” page details. related work see Datta, S. & Blanchard, J. L. effects seasonal processes size spectrum dynamics. Canadian Journal Fisheries Aquatic Sciences (2016). https://cdnsciencepub.com/doi/full/10.1139/cjfas-2015-0468

title: Animation of the gonadic mass spectra — animateGonadSpectra
code: animateGonadSpectra(   sim,   species = NULL,   time_range,   wlim = c(NA, NA),   ylim = c(NA, NA),   power = 0 )

title: Animation of the gonadic mass spectra — animateGonadSpectra
text: sim MizerSim object species Name vector names species plotted. default species plotted. time_range time range animate . Either vector values vector min max time. Default entire time range simulation. wlim numeric vector length two providing lower upper limits w axis. Use NA refer existing minimum maximum. ylim numeric vector length two providing lower upper limits y axis. Use NA refer existing minimum maximum. values 1e-20 always cut . power gonadic mass density plotted number density times per-capita gonadic mass times weight raised power. default power = o gives gonadic mass density, whereas power =   1 gives gonadic mass density respect logarithmic size bins.

title: Plot density-dependent reproduction rate over time — plotRDD
text: sim object class MizerSim sim2 optional second object class MizerSim. provided RDDs shown plot bolder lines. species species selected. Optional. default target species selected. vector species names, numeric vector species indices, logical vector indicating species whether selected (TRUE) . total boolean value determines whether total species system plotted well. Note even plot shows selection species, total including species. Default FALSE. log Boolean whether RDD plotted logarithmic axis. Defaults true. highlight Name vector names species highlighted. return_data boolean value determines whether formatted data used plot returned instead plot . Default value FALSE ... arguments (currently unused)

what: Beverton Holt function to calculate density-dependent reproduction rate — seasonalBevertonHoltRDD
title: Beverton Holt function to calculate density-dependent reproduction rate — seasonalBevertonHoltRDD
text: Takes density-independent rates \(R_{di}\) egg production (calculated getRDI()) returns reduced, density-dependent reproduction rates \(R_{dd}\) given $$R_{dd} = R_{di} \frac{R_{max}}{R_{di} + R_{max}}$$ \(R_{max}\) maximum possible reproduction rates must specified column species parameter dataframe. (quantities equation species-specific dropped species index simplicity.)

title: Beverton Holt function to calculate density-dependent reproduction rate — seasonalBevertonHoltRDD
Beverton Holt function to calculate density-dependent reproduction rate — seasonalBevertonHoltRDD
text: rdi Vector density-independent reproduction rates \(R_{di}\) species. params params object must contain other_params$R_max t time calculate RDD ... Unused

title: Beverton Holt function to calculate density-dependent reproduction rate — seasonalBevertonHoltRDD
text: Vector density-dependent reproduction rates.

title: Beverton Holt function to calculate density-dependent reproduction rate — seasonalBevertonHoltRDD
text: one example density-dependence. can write function based example, returning different density-dependent reproduction rates. Three examples provided RickerRDD(), SheperdRDD(), noRDD() constantRDD(). explanation see setReproduction().

what: Gaussian mass-specific gonad release rate — seasonalGaussianRelease
title: Gaussian mass-specific gonad release rate — seasonalGaussianRelease
text: Uses formula $$r(w, t) = r(t) = r_0 \exp{\left(-\dfrac{(t-\lfloor{t}\rfloor-t_0)^2}{2\sigma^2}\right)}$$ parameters \(r_0, \sigma\) \(t_0\) given new columns sr_r0, sr_sigma sr_t0 species parameter data frame. mizer measures time years, \(t-\lfloor t \rfloor\) gives time within year \(r(t)\) periodic function period one year.

what: von-Mises distributed gonad release rate — seasonalVonMisesRelease
title: von-Mises distributed gonad release rate — seasonalVonMisesRelease
text: Uses formula $$r(t) = r_0 \frac{\exp(\kappa \cos(2\pi(t - \mu)))}{2\pi I_0(\kappa)}$$ parameters taken vonMises_r0, vonMises_kappa vonMises_mu columns species_params data frame params.
